data: Marcel reappeared next day at three o’clock, his face green, his eyes bloodshot, a lump on his forehead, his breeches torn, his breath tainted with a strong smell of brandy, and his person covered with dirt.
Bouvard and Pécuchet: A Tragi-comic Novel of Bourgeois Life, part 2
